description.narrative: Detta är en ny komponent till befintliga bidrag "Investment Climate Reform" 55030011, genomförs av IFC. Det syftar till att förbereda den moldaviska näringslivet för de nya utmaningar och krav som kommer efter Moldavien ansluter sig till djupgående och omfattande frihandelsområde med EU.

This is a new component to the existing contribution "Investment Climate Reform" 55030011, implemented by IFC. It aims at preparing the Moldovan business community for the new challenges and requirements that will come after Moldova joins the Deep and Comprehensive Free Trade Area with EU.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2014Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: Within the context of signing the Association Agreement, including DCFTA between Moldova and the EU on June 24, 2014, the Project launched the first country-wide campaign on DCFTA awareness for the private sector. 27 workshops have been conducted from August throughout October 2014 reaching out more than 700 participants with very positive feedback. Most of the participants were operating in the agrifood sector as was stipulated by selection criteria’ process. This concerned producers of fruits and vegetables but also processors (e.g. from meat or dairy sectors, canned fruits and vegetables, etc.), producers of animal feed, cereals, honey, etc. Therefore, a focus was given to information on market access rules for agricultural products and foodstuff. The topics of the training were: Introduction to EU related information sources; EU legislation for the agrifood sector; Using information sources and web platforms for searching interesting markets in the EU and contact data of importers; EU market developments and market access requirements (MAR) in the FFV field; Negotiation strategies; Exposure on foreign market; Concluding export/import contract with EU partners; Financial instruments offered by Moldovan financial sector for exporters. In addition to training activities, sectorial working groups were created, with the goal to ensure active participation of business community in local and national process of the implementation of the DCFTA by ensuring a platform for dialogue between the business and Government agencies. Also, a Communication Strategy on DCFTA was developed for the Government. It is to be implemented either as a single document, or to be reflected in the strategies of relevant ministries/agencies.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
